page.title: 09 BIGNELL HOUSE
page.content: Bignell house was built in 1866 for the Misses Tyrwhitt-Drake for 5,500 pounds.It was designed by William Wilkinson who also designed the Randolph hotel(Oxford).It changed hands in 1884 and was greatly extended.The farm comprised of 1,460 acres including a stud farm.Many rare trees were introduced into the arboretum. The house changed hands again in 1936 .It was used during the war as a school and also housed sergeants and evacuees.The house changed hands twice more before present owners took over in 1979.Much of the house had been demolished in the 1950's.Today there are only 16 acres left out of the much larger estate.The gardens are open for the National Gardens scheme. What remains now is only one wing which was added to the house by Hoare as a nursery wing.
